Day 1.title: World Red Cross and Red Crescent Day

facts.1: World Red Cross and Red Crescent Day is celebrated on May 8th to honor the principles of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement.
facts.2: The day marks the birth anniversary of Henry Dunant, the founder of the International Committee of the Red Cross and the first Nobel Peace Prize laureate.
facts.3: The Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement provides humanitarian aid and disaster relief to millions of people worldwide.

facts.1: National Have a Coke Day celebrates the iconic Coca-Cola beverage, which was first introduced on May 8, 1886.
facts.2: Coca-Cola was invented by Dr. John Stith Pemberton, a pharmacist in Atlanta, Georgia.
facts.3: Today, Coca-Cola is one of the most recognized and consumed beverages globally, with a presence in over 200 countries.

facts.1: National Teacher Appreciation Day is celebrated on the first Tuesday of May to honor and recognize the contributions of teachers.
facts.2: The day encourages students and parents to show their appreciation for teachers through gifts, cards, and special events.
facts.3: Teachers play a crucial role in shaping the future by educating and inspiring the next generation.
